modules.description: The module offers tools for constructing and manipulating logical terms and types, including SMT-LIB2 statement generation, error reporting with location tracking, and pretty-printing for formal logic systems. It handles data structures like terms, types, variables, and SMT declarations, supporting operations such as arithmetic/bitvector handling, quantifier management, and solver command generation. Use cases include formal verification, constraint solving, and generating human-readable representations for debugging or analysis.

The module provides operations for constructing and manipulating logical terms, SMT-LIB2 statements, and abstract syntax tree (AST) components, including logical connectives, quantifiers, type casting, and SMT-LIB command wrappers. It works with types like terms, types, variables, and SMT-LIB locations, supporting use cases such as theorem proving, SMT-LIB2 assertion generation, and pretty-printing for debugging or code generation.

Represents source code locations with file, start, and end positions, supporting creation from strings and positions, equality checks, and pretty-printing. It handles lexical buffer data to track file names and positions, enabling detailed error reporting. Used to generate human-readable location information for parser errors and diagnostics.

Parses SMT-LIB syntax into abstract syntax trees for types, terms, and statements using a provided lexer. Processes input streams to construct lists of statements or individual statements based on grammar rules. Accepts a token generator and lexing buffer to analyze and convert symbolic expressions into structured representations.

manages logical terms, types, and SMT-LIB2 interactions through structured data like terms, variables, and declarations, with support for arithmetic, bitvectors, and quantifiers. it enables error tracking with location info, pretty-printing of logical expressions, and generation of solver commands. users can construct complex logical formulas, debug with annotated error messages, and output readable representations for analysis. it facilitates formal verification tasks by translating abstract logic into executable SMT commands.

combines term construction, SMT-LIB2 parsing, and location tracking to support logical expression manipulation and verification. it handles terms, types, variables, and SMT-LIB locations, enabling operations like formula building, pretty-printing, and command generation. it parses SMT-LIB syntax into ASTs and tracks source positions for error reporting. users can create complex logical expressions, debug with location-aware errors, and generate solver-compatible output.

Parses SMTLIB2 expressions and commands using menhir, handling terms, formulas, and declarations. Works with custom AST types representing logical expressions and SMT commands. Used to process SMT benchmarks and extract constraints for analysis or transformation.

Constructs and manipulates logical expressions by combining term creation, SMT-LIB2 parsing, and location tracking. It manages terms, variables, and types, supporting formula building, pretty-printing, and command generation with source position awareness. Users can parse SMT-LIB syntax into abstract syntax trees, debug with precise error locations, and output solver-ready commands. Examples include constructing quantified formulas, tracking variable origins in parsed input, and generating well-formed SMT-LIB commands.
